intro: Alchornea bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá alchorne, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. It has a woody stem and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
